description.narrative: WASH: Rehabilitation and construction of water wells, distribution of hygiene kits, conducting hygiene promotion sessions. Protection: Provision of Mobile outreach services, Provide quality and timely case management services and referrals through increasing thelinkage between child protection and gender-based violence (GBV) case management including development of standard operating procedures for care for child survivors and referral pathways at district and community level, and Provide multi-sectoral survivor centered GBV services to IDPs, returnees and host communities, including drought affected, through improved GBV coordination. Project Summary: The action proposed qualifies as an immediate multi-sector emergency response to the current drought with integration of gender and protection, developed around engagement with local communities and local authorities. The activities will revolve around two main sectors: - Provision of emergency WASH assistance: access to safe water and hygiene promotion; - Implementation of protection activities, focused on prevention and response to GBV, outreach of victims of GBV, provision of referrals systems and case management and establishment of safe spaces for women. The intervention aims at integrating the two sectors to provide a comprehensive response to the communities affected by drought: WASH activities including provision of safe water and attention to health and protection assistance to GBV victims and gender activities will be mainstreamed in the entire implementation through community outreach, mobilization and awareness raising. Oxfam will implement these WASH and Protection response activities in close coordination with other organizations implementing emergency food security and livelihoods activities in the same locations which will further contribute to complementarity. It is critical in this moment in time to provide immediate support in the areas affected by the drought: - In order to prevent further displacement: a significant number of communities are leaving their homes searching for water and areas suitable for agriculture and livestock; - In order to ensure that the conditions of women and girls do not degenerate: deep poverty and deprivation have a heavy toll on women and girls,often more vulnerable and more exposed to risks, especially GBV. The action will be implemented by Oxfam and two local sub implementing partners, each one with specific sector expertise, in a logic of promoting local humanitarian leadership and of broader outreach of beneficiaries, leveraging on the connection and knowledge of the territory that the local partners provide. In a conflict-torn country, where insecurity and poverty have been impacting local population for long, it is critical to provide immediate support and support local communities in their quest for resilience and security.

participating-org.narrative: The Afghan Development Association (ADA) was established in 1990 with the purpose of improving agricultural productivity in rural Afghanistan. Agricultural areas have suffered considerably as a result of almost 24 years of civil war in the country. Theirrigation system of canals and karezes (small water tunnels), on which large parts of agrarian land depend, were damaged or destroyed, or goneinto disuse after years of neglect. The consequences of the civil war include the displacement of large numbers of people and severe disruption of the economy and livelihoods of numerous poor families. ADA has concentrated its efforts in the southern and western regions of the country. Given the relative security and stability in these areas during Taliban rule,thedisplaced and refugee population of the region has been gradually returning from surrounding areas and countries. The drought prevailing for the last three years has, however, slowed down the repatriation process to some extent. The returning populationis in need of continued support to facilitate their re-integration. ADA has developed a multi-sectoral, integrated rural development package that includes the rehabilitation of irrigation systems, horticulture development, agricultural inputs (such as fertilisers, improved seed varieties, tools), veterinary training, health education, vocational training, and environmental conservation. Oxfam Novib has provided support to ADA for Integrated Rural Development Projects for several years entailing thefollowing aspects of development: encouraging and facilitating return of refugees; rehabilitating and developing rural infrastructure including farm activities; creating employment and livelihood opportunities; facilitating socio-economic reintegration; and ensuring the participation of local communities in the rural rehabilitation activities. Major components covered with Oxfam Novib support have included: the rehabilitation of rural infrastructure; food security; water supply; and vocational training. Theprojects have served tens of thousands of families. All these services were found useful in the direction of accomplishing broader objectives of alleviating poverty and fostering peace in Afghanistan.
